question_template: A1 has not yet dribbled when he deliberately throws the ball against the backboard, not attempting a shot, and catches it again before another player has touched it.
explanation: I24-1 If a player deliberately throws the ball against a backboard (not attempting a legitimate shot for a field goal) this is considered as if the player has bounced the ball on the floor. If the player then touches the ball again before it has touched (or been touched by) another player, this is considered as a dribble. After catching the ball A1 may shoot or pass but may not begin a new dribble.
